result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey A Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (05/24/2019)

2:59 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Ryan Helmuth present in court.  Court questions defendant regarding un-paid monies.  Statement by defendant - was just released from prison in January of this year.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 3:00 p.m.
Probation review hearing on April 16, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant called and requested this matter be rescheduled to 3:00 p.m. as he has a job.
43
Probation review hearing on April 16, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Settlement Form (PTC)

11:17 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, 2016CF48 will be a prelim waiver and requests 2016CF23 be tracked with that case, and defendant will plea to the balance of the cases.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to Counts 1 & 3 in 2015CM72; Count 1 in 2015CF103 and Counts 1 & 3 in 2016CF14.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 3 on 2015CM72, strikes the repeater and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2015CF103 and finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 3 as charged on 2016CF14.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Statement by Bob Dore.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CM72 

Count 1

-$100.00 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA Sample

Count 3 

-30 days county jail, with huber.  To commence immediately.
-Court costs.
-DNA sample

2015CF103

-Count 1 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $1,467.97
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CF14

Count 1 

-60 days county jail.  
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample

Count 3

-30 days county jail.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample

All jail sentences are to be consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber, to commence immediately.  Court grants out of county travel and out of county service.

Court grants sentence credit as determined by the jail.

16CF48 - Statement by Atty Privat - Defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets 2016CF23 & 2016CF48 for Status Hearing on July 5, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.  

Statement by Atty Privat - requests to address bond on 2016CF48 and requests a signature bond.  Statement by DA Christenson - does not agree with a reduction in bond.  Court denies the defendant's request to modify bond.

Court adjourned at 11:42 a.m.
Status hearing on June 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

4:34 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - have offers in some of the cases and received Discovery in the newer cases.  Court sets for Status Hearing on June 7, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 4:35 p.m.
Status hearing on May 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

9:16 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by 
Atty Privat - defendant will be waiving his right to a prelim in 2016CF14 & 2016CF23.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination on 2016CF14 & 2016CF23.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelims and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files the informations with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the informations and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets all cases for Status Hearing on May 3, 2016 at 3:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 9:21 a.m.
